connector.description: Store and retrieve messages from Azure Storage Queue Service.

camel.source.endpoint.credentials.name: camel.source.endpoint.credentials
camel.source.endpoint.credentials.description: Set the storage credentials, required in most cases

camel.source.endpoint.validateClientURI.name: camel.source.endpoint.validateClientURI
camel.source.endpoint.validateClientURI.description: Whether to validate the Azure client URI

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.credentialsAccount.name: camel.source.endpoint.credentialsAccountKey
camel.source.endpoint.credentialsAccount.description: Set the storage account key used during authentication phase

camel.source.endpoint.credentialsAccount.name: camel.source.endpoint.credentialsAccountName
camel.source.endpoint.credentialsAccount.description: Set the storage account name used during authentication phase

camel.component.azure-queue.credentials.name: camel.component.azure-queue.credentials
camel.component.azure-queue.credentials.description: Set the storage credentials, required in most cases

camel.component.azure-queue.validateClie.name: camel.component.azure-queue.validateClientURI
camel.component.azure-queue.validateClie.description: Whether to validate the Azure client URI

camel.component.azure-queue.bridgeErrorH.name: camel.component.azure-queue.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.azure-queue.bridgeErrorH.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.azure-queue.autowiredEna.name: camel.component.azure-queue.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.azure-queue.autowiredEna.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.azure-queue.credentialsA.name: camel.component.azure-queue.credentialsAccountKey
camel.component.azure-queue.credentialsA.description: Set the storage account key used during authentication phase

camel.component.azure-queue.credentialsA.name: camel.component.azure-queue.credentialsAccountName
camel.component.azure-queue.credentialsA.description: Set the storage account name used during authentication phase
